page.title: 02 LOCAL HISTORY cont.
page.content: Nearby, on Roman Bank there was once a row of old cottages perhaps used by Woadmen. They now have old folks bungalows on the site. Woad was grown at the time of the Domesday Survey and indeed in Roman times. Our teacher still grows woad in his garden. Woad has been grown for centuries but was last grown commercially at Skirbeck, near Boston, Lincs. before 1932, having had a rejuvenation in the Napoleonic wars 1793-1815. It was grown in Long Sutton in 1797 probably down Woad Lane. Since the 16th century the better quality indigo from India has been used as a blue dye. Since 1878 blue dye has been made in the chemist's laboratory.
